title: pakhitheboss
author: pakhitheboss
content: I am not so into finding jugad but considering the tax issue I went ahead and checked with one of my friend who is always using Amazon & Flipkart for most of his domestic requirements. The reason for me asking such a stupid question was to find out whether you can cash an Amazon gift card using Amazon pay. I found out that you can transfer the gift card amount to your bank account but you need to pass full KYC. Now the question that came into my mind was is their any tax involved for using a coupon on an Amazon or any other online platform? If yes then why use Bitrefill? If not then what are the implications of passing KYC of Amazon pay? I am aware the max you can get as a gift coupons is 5k as I recently made a purchase on Bitrefill. The problem is if I pass full KYC can I still cashout with regular intervals before Amazon start questioning my transaction?If anyone here has tried it please leave a reply.Thanks in advance. P.S- Please ignore my typo mistake as this time is midnight for me.

comments.author: IIrik11
comments.body: what will u show it in the income tax?that u sold some items on amazon and received money from it?that would again be taxable if your total source of income is taxable ie.best thing to do is to buy stuff with it that u buy anyway.but if your total income falls below the taxable income then i don't see any problems with amazon kyc.also, i am not sure but i think u can get amazon pay card that can be used to spend/withdraw money.
